name: CAVIAR
description: CAVIAR (CAusal Variants Identication in Associated Regions), a statistical framework that quantifies the probability of each variant to be causal while allowing with arbitrary number of causal variants.

name: Tophat2
description: TopHat is a fast splice junction mapper for RNA-Seq reads. It aligns RNA-Seq reads to mammalian-sized genomes using the ultra high-throughput short read aligner Bowtie, and then analyzes the mapping results to identify splice junctions between exons.

name: Sailfish
description: Sailfish: Rapid Alignment-free Quantification of Isoform Abundance. RNA-seq expression estimates need not take longer than a cup of coffee
funding: Alfred P. Sloan Foundation Sloan Research Fellowship to Carl Kingsford

name: SPA
description: Spatial Ancestry analysis (SPA) is a method for predicting ancestry or where an individual is from using the individual's DNA. Accurately modeling ancestry is an important step in identifying genetic variation involved in disease.
funding: IBM open collaborative research award program

name: HARSH
description: HAplotype inference using Reference and Sequencing tecHnology (HARSH) is a method to infer the haplotype using haplotype reference panel and high throughput sequencing data. It is based on a novel probabilistic model and Gibbs sampler method.
funding: NINDS Informatics Center for Neurogenetics and Neurogenomics (P30 NS062691)

name: MyGene.info
description: MyGene.info provides simple-to-use REST web services to query/retrieve gene annotation data. It’s designed with simplicity and performance emphasized. You can use it to power a web application which requires querying genes and obtaining common gene annotations. For example, MyGene.info services are used to power BioGPS; or use it in an analysis pipeline to retrieve always up-to-date gene annotations.

name: MedInria
description: medInria is a multi-platform medical image processing and visualization software. It is free and open-source. Through an intuitive user interface, medInria offers from standard to cutting-edge processing functionalities for your medical images such as 2D/3D/4D image visualization, image registration, diffusion MR processing and tractography.

name: FusionViewer
description: FusionViewer is a platform-independent open source visualization tool allowing flexible fusion PET-CT displays. It displays simultaneous orthogonal views with variable transparency of the functional (PET) overlay over an anatomical (CT) background. It provides color maps and other standard image viewing controls.

name: ezDICOM
description: Designed to display most medical images: MRI, CT, X-ray, and ultrasound. Can view a wide range of medical images including proprietary formats as well as DICOM. Can be integrated into other programs.

name: MicroView
description: An open source, freely distributed 3D volume viewer. Cross-platform. MicroView includes numerous image analysis tools and plug-ins. Features include isosuraces, volume rendering, surface shading, reslicing.

name: DICOMscope
description: DICOMscope is a free DICOM viewer which can display uncompressed, monochrome DICOM images from all modalities and which supports monitor calibration according to DICOM part 14 as well as presentation states. DICOMscope offers a print client (DICOM Basic Grayscale Print Management) which also implements the optional Presentation LUT SOP Class.

name: Synedra View Personal
description: Synedra View is a highly polished DICOM viewer with excellent functionality for basic features. Synedra View also supports multiplanar reconstructions, linked multiple windows, multiple monitors. Native 64 bit for large data sets. PACS query and retrieve functionality.

name: Vinci
description: Vinci (Volume Imaging in Neurological Research, Co-Registration and ROIs included&) was designed for the visualization and analysis of volume data, particularly neurological PET scans. It supports DICOM and several file formats common in nuclear medicine applications: ECAT and Interfile. Vinci support multiple orthogonal displays, VOI and ROI features, modifiable color maps, and several reslicing/resampling modes. Co-registration is provided in automatic and semi-automatic modes. The program is based on an extensible plugin framework and may be scripted and remotely controlled through an API.

name: Weasis
description: Weasis is a multipurpose web-based viewer with a highly modular architecture. It can connect to any PACS server supporting WADO via a web portal. In particular, it has been used with the DCM4CHEE PACS server. Weasis provides a wide range of image viewing tools in an application that may automatically be downloaded along with a data set accessed from a web server. It can also be run as a platform independent Java stand-alone application and stored on a DVD along with a data set. It uses a plugin architecture to allow expansion through software components.

name: Ginkgo CADx
description: Ginkgo CADx is an open-source extensible image acquisition, viewing and analysis application, available for Windows, Mac and Linux platforms. Built on the Ginkgo CADx Framework, it has a plug-in architecture for specialized analysis. It is DICOM compliant with PACS integration to send and receive images, and has HL7 support. The 2D viewer has image manipulation and annotation tools, and can open multiple simultaneous studies.

name: MINC Brain Imaging Toolbox
description: Comprised of a large array of sophisticated programs, this comprehensive package is from the Brain Imaging Center at the Montreal Neurological Institute, McGill University. All the tools are based around the MINC file format. Utilities are provided for conversion, viewing, editing, registering, segmentation, and a wide array of analysis. Many programs are in Perl.

name: AMC Postprocessing Package
description: The AMC Postprocessing Package processes and displays MRI data sets. It can register, reslice and overlay functional scans on top of anatomical scans. Multi datasets, multiple viewports, plugin architecture, multithreading core, multiprocessor capable, platform independent (Qt/VTK).

name: CreaTools
description: CreaTools comprise a development environment and prepared applications for medical image visualization and processing (filtering, contouring, etc.). CreaTools contains high-level (pipeline scripting) and low-level (C++ programming) libraries for students and researchers to create applications based on the existing components.

name: Carimas
description: CarimasTurku is a Cardiac Image Analysis System developed using the IDL language in Turku PET Centre, Turku Finland. This program is designed for visualising and analyzing PET studies. Multiple modalities (PET/MRI) can be loaded and the images fused. Regions of interest can be drawn and stored for analysis. Many modelling programs from the Turku PET centre are built into the application.

name: ClearCanvas
description: Code base for open source 2D imaging workstation with PACS client and server capabilities. Based on the ClearCanvas SDK (also available). Has an explorer-type layout with tabbed pages, each with customizable window layout. User interface has intuitive controls and drag-and-drop capabilities.

name: eviewbox
description: An open source portable digital lightbox. Runs as app, applet, and non-Java Windows version.

name: RadScaper
description: Radscaper is a powerful Java applet based DICOM web viewer with a thin footprint. It requires no installation or configuration. It can read DICOM images and header information from any PACS system that provides a Web interface. It is extremely easy to use and runs on any platform.

name: JiveX DICOM Viewer
description: DICOM viewer from a spin-off of the University of Witten/Herdecke. Runs on Windows, Mac, and Linux, and features a full set of viewing options. Supplied with a 60-page manual in German and English. Can only read limited number of files due to licensing restriction.

name: DVS: Dicom Viewing Software
description: DVS is a Windows program which lets a cardiologist visualize patients angio sequences on his/her PC, Analyze selected images (frame by frame viewing, contrast and brightness adjustment, ...),Send images/sequences to your colleagues via internet.

name: CarDiCon
description: DICOM Viewer for Cardiac X-Ray Angiographic Studies, DICOM=>AVI Conversion Utility.

name: MVE - Medical Volume Explorer
description: MVE - Medical Volume Explorer - is a visualization program for medical data. It is based on OpenGL, GLScene and on Cg shaders from NVIDIA. The program supports different 2D views (axial, coronal and sagittal), Multi Planar Reformation (MPR), Direct Volume Rendering, Maximum Intensity Projection (MIP) gradient lighting and a stereoscopic anaglyph visualization. MVE has a multi format file interface for CT, MRI, PET and SPECT data and can read DICOM, ANALYZE, BMP, JPG, GIF and TIF files.

name: MicroDicom
description: MicroDicom is a DICOM viewer for Windows with standard image viewing features. It can scan directories of DICOM files, and read DICOMDIR files. MicroDicom can read to and from image file formats such as JPG and TIFF. Available in 64-bit version for large data sets. Also available is a Windows shell extension for quick preview of DICOM files from Windows Explorer.

name: MIView
description: A program to read/write and display multiple medical image formats. Visualization methods will include planar views, orthogonal, multi-planar reconstruction (MPR), maximum intensity projection (MIP), volume rendering, and surface shaded display (SSD).

name: MedImaView
description: A simple and straightforward Windows application to view DICOM files. Features multimodality viewer, DICOMDIR browser, save to CD, cine, header data view, multiframe and cine mode.

name: TomoVision
description: TomoVision is a Windows tool which allows you to display medical images and enables the user to perform the following actions: * Scale images * Modify image brightness and contrast * Access any pixel position and value on the image. TomoVision is capable of reading a very wide range of file formats.

name: Exhalation-B
description: Browser window gives a quick preview and a full window view of the DICOM images contained in a directory. You can also see the DICOM Tag information of the image file. Supports DICOMDIR and export to TIFF format files.

name: etdips
description: Multi-dimensional volume visualization and analysis software, from NIH. Supports volume/surface rendering, multiple file formats, plugin architecture.

name: Paxera Viewer
description: Well-developed 2D DICOM viewer with easy controls. Handles multi modality, cine, DicomDir, printing, and CDs.

name: Facor: digital X Ray
description: For X ray images

name: Facor
description: DICOM image viewer and filter for Windows. Subset of full-featured commercial application. The free version is easy to use and has comprehensive conversion abilities (DICOM to JPG, PNG etc).

name: RNASkim
description: RNA-Seq technique has been demonstrated as a revolutionary means for exploring transcriptome because it provides deep coverage and base-pair level resolution. RNA-Seq quantification is proven to be an efficient alternative to Microarray technique in gene expression study, and is a critical component in RNA-Seq differential expression analysis. Most existing RNA-Seq quantification tools require the alignments of fragments to either a genome or a transcriptome, entailing a time-consuming and intricate alignment step. In order to improve the performance of RNA-Seq quantification, an alignment-free method, Sailfish, has been recently proposed to quantify transcript abundances using all k-mers in the transcriptome, demonstrating the feasibility of designing an efficient alignment free method for transcriptome quantification. Even though Sailfish is substantially faster than alternative alignment-based methods such as Cufflinks, using all k-mers in the transcriptome quantification impedes the scalability of the method. We proposed a novel RNA-Seq quantification method, RNA-Skim, which partitions the transcriptome into disjoint transcript clusters based on sequence similarity and introduces the notion of sig-mers that are a special type of k-mers uniquely associated with each cluster. We demonstrated that the sig-mer counts within a cluster are sufficient for estimating transcript abundance with an accuracy comparable to any state of the art methods. This enables RNA-Skim to perform transcript quantification on each cluster independently, reducing a complex optimization problem into smaller optimization tasks that can be run in parallel. As a result, RNA-Skim uses less than <4% of the k-mers and less than < 10% of the CPU time required by Sailfish. It is able to finish transcriptome quantification in less than 10 minutes per sample by using just a single thread on a commodity computer, which represents more than 100 speedup over the state of the art alignment based methods, while delivering comparable or higher accuracy.
institutions: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

name: SIVIC - Stereoscopic Image Vis
description: SIVIC is an open-source standards-based software framework and application suite for processing and visualization of DICOM MR Spectroscopy data. The SIVIC project provides a standalone, cross platform visualization application and plug-ins for OsiriX and Slicer. The SIVIC c++ framework extends VTK and supports reading, writing, algorithms and visualization classes for MR spectroscopy (MRS) data. The framework is extensible, and community participation and contributions are encouraged to facilitate accessibility and validation of MRS processing methodologies (recon, post-processing, quantification).

name: LONI Inspector
description: LONI Inspector is a cross-platform application for examining medical image files, focusing on reading, displaying, searching, comparing, and exporting metadata. This includes subject details, image specifications, scanner and settings, and other technical information stored with the image data. Inspector can export this information in CSV and XTML formats, and can compare multiple files for differing fields.

name: Medal
description: PC-based medical image viewer/processor. Many filtering, 2D/3D operations.

name: SkullyDoo
description: Image visualization and processing based on VTK
institutions: Universidad Nacional del Centro de la Provincia de Buenos Aires, Argentina

name: Orhanc Web Viewer
description: As a plugin for the Orthanc image store, allows viewing of Dicom images within a browser. Based on the GDCM Dicom library, and the Cornerstone Javascript library for rendering in a browser client.

name: MITK 3M3 Image Analysis
description: MITK 3M3 is a 3D image analysis and visualisation program based on the open source MITK toolkit. It has a range of image analysis tools that include time-seriies data volumes, data fusion and registration, vessel analysis, and GPU volume visualisation.

name: ImLib3D
description: ImLib3D is an open source C++ library for 3D (volumetric) image processing. Includes image processing algorithms and an optional viewer. GUI or command line capable. Alternative to ITK or Matlab.

name: Knowledge.Bio
description: Knowledge.Bio is an open access web-based “rich client desktop” computer application that provides value-added access to the network of interconnected knowledge mined in the scientific literature from more than 20,000,000 PubMed abstracts.

name: OpenSim
description: OpenSim is a freely available software system that allows you to build, exchange, and analyze musuloskeletal models and dynamic simulations of movement.

name: SNAP
description: Stanford Network Analysis Platform (SNAP) is a general purpose network analysis and graph mining library. It is written in C++ and easily scales to massive networks with hundreds of millions of nodes, and billions of edges. It efficiently manipulates large graphs, calculates structural properties, generates regular and random graphs, and supports attributes on nodes and edges. SNAP is also available through the NodeXL which is a graphical front-end that integrates network analysis into Microsoft Office and Excel.

name: Cerebral Cortex
description: A field-validated sensor data analytics framework for mHealth sensing applications by MD2K.

name: Expression Atlas
description: The Expression Atlas provides information on gene expression patterns under different biological conditions such as a gene knock out, a plant treated with a compound, or in a particular organism part or cell. It includes both microarray and RNA-seq data. The data is re-analysed in-house to detect interesting expression patterns under the conditions of the original experiment.

name: Beagle
description: Beagle, a 150 teraflops, 18,000-core Cray XE6 supercomputer that will support computation, simulation and data analysis for the biomedical research community.

name: rMATS
description: MATS is a computational tool to detect differential alternative splicing events from RNA-Seq data. The statistical model of MATS calculates the P-value and false discovery rate that the difference in the isoform ratio of a gene between two conditions exceeds a given user-defined threshold. From the RNA-Seq data, MATS can automatically detect and analyze alternative splicing events corresponding to all major types of alternative splicing patterns. MATS handles replicate RNA-Seq data from both paired and unpaired study design.

name: Sobox Image Viewer
description: DICOM file viewer with PACS client abilities, and internal relational database to permit local storage of received DICOM files. Can act as Storage Service Provider. Supports measurement of lengths and areas within images, creation of DICOMDIR, CD burning, AVI file export, printing. Can be run from a USB drive.

name: Onis Viewer
description: Onis is an expandable DICOM/PACS workstation for Windows. The free version forms the basis for commercial versions, which allow further plugins and a larger database. The viewer builds a local database of imported images for speed and ease of organization. The image display is highly customizable and the program can display MIP and multiplanar reconstructions in addition to lightbox mode. For analysis, regions of interest (ROIs) can be defined and stored, and values within them measured and analyzed. Images may be viewed directly from a remote PACS server without first being imported into the database. A modular plugin architecture makes expansion possible. The program is multi threaded for efficient use of multicore processors.

name: MEDISP DICOM viewer
description: MEDISP is a program for displaying Dicom files in many transfer syntaxes and modalities. It has flexible image processing abilities and is particularly designed for educational use.
institutions: Medical Image & Signal Processing Lab, Technological Education Institution of Athens, Greece

name: Oviyam 2
description: Oviyam is a web-based DICOM viewer that requires no special client software or downloads of any kind. It is installed as a component on a PACS server and delivers image files as standard HTML5 to any compatible web browser. Oviyam uses standard Web protocols to allow PACS querying, and retrieval and display of selected series or studies. It is packaged and deployed on the JBoss application framework, and can communicate with any WADO-compatible PACS server

name: MyFreePACS
description: About MyFreePACS MyFreePACS is a free web-based radiology image storage and viewing tool. MyFreePACS was developed to provide an easy-to-use, HIPAA-compliant method for viewing Radiology images from anywhere on a hospital network, or remotely over VPN. MyFreePACS uses a full DICOM server to receive and store images, and then is able to transmit them over the web to the MyFreePACS web client. The MyFreePACS web client is a web page that utilizes an ActiveX control for viewing and manipulation of images.

name: RView
description: This software integrates a number of 3D/4D data display and fusion routines together with 3D rigid volume registration using Normalised Mutual information. It also contains many interactive volume segmentation and painting functions for structural data analysis.

name: VV: the 4D viewer
description: VV is an open-source and cross platform image viewer, designed for fast and simple visualization of spatio-temporal images. It can display 2D and 3D images as a static volume or as a time series. VV is more specifically designed for qualitative evaluation of image registration and deformation field visualization. It contains several tools for superimposing images using complementary colors or transparency, visualizing vector fields and defining landmarks.

name: JDicom
description: Java DICOM Tools with extensive server capabilities.

name: MAYAM
description: A DICOM viewer implemented using the DCM4CHE Java toolkit. Features a local database for structured storage of studies, and the ability to send and receive studies to and from a PACS server. Has a multiple study viewer with a tabbed interface, modality-based layout and windowing, overlays, JPG export, cine and stack navigation. Has volume rendering capabilities (2D and 3D MPR, volume and surface rendering).

name: DicomLite
description: Simple DICOM viewer offering the most useful viewing functions. Fast and efficient, supports zoom, contrast and intensity, drag and drop image opening and batch conversion.

name: Visible Paient
description: Visible Patient is a Dicom viewer with multiplanar and volume rendering. It is designed for pre-surgical planning by visualizing and interacting with the 3D patient anatomy. Organ segmentation and virtual resection are also features.

name: SATURN
description: SATURN is a cross-platform application for Diffusion Tensor Imaging (DTI) analysis and visualization. It can compute and visualize scalar magnitudes derived from DTI data, perform tractography, perform automatic fiber clustering, perform glyph rendering, compute measures over regions of interest (ROIs) and along fiber tracts, and edit fibers and ROIs. It can also open and view scalar MRI volumes in DICOM and several other formats. SATURN is developed with the FLTK toolkit for full platform independence and a consistent user interface.

name: Facor: 3D MRI
description: For 3D MRI and Angio

name: Ogles2
description: Ogles (OpenGL expandable stereotaxy) is a three-dimensional volume and slice data visualization tool based on OpenGL and Ogle. Ogles vision is to integrate a neuro-analytical framework into a stereotactic planning system. Ogles embarked on creating an open source data model that allows to analyze neuro-imaging data in an inter-subject reference system to utilize neuro-analysis for stereotactic planning, and to validate stereotactic procedures in the context of multi modal imaging.

name: DICOM Parser
description: Displays DICOM header from selected files. Has a second window that shows hex equivalent values and offsets within the file.

name: Cornerstone
description: Cornerstone Core is a lightweight Javascript library for displaying medical image files in a web browser using HTML5 Canvas. Cornerstone is not restricted to a particular pixel container or transport mechanism, and does not define an interaction paradigm. As such, it may be adapted to any image format using an extensible image loader class, and can utilise present and future transport protocols and user interaction technique. The project is distributed as an open source Javascript library with a documented API, and a reference implementation which is also a working demonstration.

name: Yakami DICOM Tools
description: Yakami DICOM tools include a wide range of applications to handle DICOM files for research. They include a viewer for many DICOM formats and synchronized multiple-series windows and image fusion. A DICOM converter is highly configurable and may be used as an anonymized. Other programs can move and rename DICOM files and folders according to information in the file headers. Several other programs combine the abilities of applications in the package.

name: ORS Viewer Lite
description: ORS Viewer Lite is an advanced image viewing and analysis workstation approved by the US FDA, Health Canada, and CE marked for Europe. Extensive configuration options are available, including custom rules sets for study anonymization. A web interface is available for quick configuration of DICOM networking. ORS Viewer integrates into the clinical workflow with DICOM networking for query/retrieve, user configuration and login control, image fusion and registration, modality-specific specialized modes, and DICOM print, report, and media creation. A commercial version is available which adds 3D viewing, image segmentation, specialty imaging plugins, and integration with an available web and mobile viewing add-on.

name: VVNT: Volume Visualization
description: Volume Visualization and Naviagtion Tool (VVNT) provides a platform to visualize, navigate, process and analyze the multi-modality multi-dimensional medical images.

name: Orpalis Dicom Viewer
description: Simple Dicom viewer for Windows

name: Santesoft DICOM Viewer 3D
description: Native Windows DICOM viewer with isosurface and various projection techniques

name: dicom3tools
description: Tools and libraries for handling offline files of DICOM attributes, and conversion of proprietary formats to DICOM. This package is from the authoratative source on DICOM. Includes the programs dciodvfy and dcentvfy, for validating the content of DICOM part 10 files against the DICOM standard.

name: PSEA-Quant
description: PSEA-Quant is a protein set enrichment analysis algorithm for label-free and label-based mass spectrometry-based quantitative proteomics. It identifies protein sets from the Gene Ontology and Molecular Signature databases that are statistically significantly enriched with abundant proteins, which are measured with high reproducibility across a set of replicates.

name: kradview
description: Kradview is a simple DICOM image viewer for Linux. It allows local DICOM files to be individually viewed, and provides for zoom and window level adjustment. It is available through Linux package distributions such as yum.

name: BRAINS
description: Image analysis, manual and automated tools for structural identification and methods for tissue classification and cortical surface generation, for MR, PET, SPECT and FMRI.

name: BioGPS
description: A free extensible and customizable gene annotation portal, a complete resource for learning about gene and protein function.

name: Navegatium DICOM Viewer
description: Navegatium is a Dicom viewer with a touchscreen-oriented user interface and PACS client (C-FIND, C-MOVE, WADO) capability. MPR and MIP projections may be displayed along with planar views. Annotations, measurements and reports are included features. Can parse and input images from local files, PACS, or the Navegatium Knowledge Base of sample data.

name: Lipsia
description: Lipsia is a collection of command line tools for processing functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) data. It runs on Windows and was developed in C++ for high performance. Lipsia contains software tools for all aspects of fMRI data processing: registration and normalization, preprocessing, exploratory processing, statistical evaluation, region of interest analysis, timecourse analysis, visualization, rendering, and converters to various data formats.

name: Mark2Cure
description: Mark2Cure works by teaching citizen scientists to precisely identify concepts and concept relationships in biomedical text. This is a task that anyone can learn to do and can perform better than any known computer program. Once these tasks are completed, advanced statistical algorithms take the data provided by the volunteers and use it to provide scientists with new tools for finding the information that they require within the sea of biomedical knowledge.

name: Big Data Dashboard
description: This webapp combines and integrates multiple socioeconomic and medical datasets using big data analytics, in order to provide a lightweight, scalable platform for drawing inferences related to medical care, sociology, and economy in the United States.

name: DeepDive
description: DeepDive is a new type of data management system that enables one to tackle extraction, integration, and prediction problems in a single system, which allows users to rapidly construct sophisticated end-to-end data pipelines, such as, dark data BI systems.
authors: Michael Cafarella, Michael Fitzpatrick, Raphael Hoffman, Alex Ratner, Zifei Shan, Jaeho Shin, Feiran Wang, Sen Wu, Ce Zhang, Christopher Ré
platforms: GNU/Linux: Debian (7, 8, or later) and Ubuntu (12.04LTS, 14.04LTS, or later)

name: Infobox Editor (IBE)
description: The InfoBox Editor (IBE) is a user-friendly interface that enables users to create and edit structured summaries without requiring any knowledge about the underlying terminology of the summaries. By mining existing text in Wikipedia (or any user-supplied text) on a subject, IBE generates a structured summary about the subject and suggests possibly missing attributes for which the user may want to provide further information.

name: Genome STRiP
description: Structural variation discovery and genotyping

name: pyLMM
description: A fast and lightweight python-based linear mixed-model solver for use in genome-wide association studies.

name: Scripps Genome Adviser
description: Small variant and CNV annotation pipeline

name: GT-FAR
description: Genome and Transcriptome Free Analysis of RNA (GT-FAR). RNA seq pipeline that allows users to do  Alignment, Quantification, Differential Expression, and Variant Calling

name: GT-FAR
description: RNA seq pipeline that allows users to do  Alignment, Quantification, Differential Expression, and Variant Calling

name: Pegasus Workflow Management System
description:
The Pegasus project encompasses a set of technologies that help workflow-based applications execute in a number of different environments including desktops, campus clusters, grids, and clouds. Pegasus bridges the scientific domain and the execution environment by automatically mapping high-level workflow descriptions onto distributed resources. It automatically locates the necessary input data and computational resources necessary for workflow execution.Pegasus enables scientists to construct workflows in abstract terms without worrying about the details of the underlying execution environment or the particulars of the low-level specifications required by the middleware (HTCondor, Globus, or Amazon EC2). Pegasus also bridges the current  cyberinfrastructure by effectively coordinating multiple distributed resources.

Pegasus has been used in a number of scientific domains including astronomy, bioinformatics, earthquake science , gravitational wave physics, ocean science, limnology, and others. When errors occur, Pegasus tries to recover when possible by retrying tasks, by retrying the entire workflow, by providing workflow-level checkpointing, by re-mapping portions of the workflow, by trying alternative data sources for staging data, and, when all else fails, by providing a rescue workflow containing a description of only the work that remains to be done. It cleans up storage as the workflow is executed so that data-intensive workflows have enough space to execute on storage-constrained resources]. Pegasus keeps track of what has been done (provenance) including the locations of data used and produced, and which software was used with which parameters.
linkDescriptions: Pegasus for Genome and Transcriptome Free Analysis of RNA

name: GATK
description: The Genome Analysis Toolkit or GATK is a software package developed at the Broad Institute to analyze high-throughput sequencing data. The toolkit offers a wide variety of tools, with a primary focus on variant discovery and genotyping as well as strong emphasis on data quality assurance. Its robust architecture, powerful processing engine and high-performance computing features make it capable of taking on projects of any size.
institutions: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard

name: GenomeVIP
description: GenomeVIP is web-based platform for conducting variant discovery on Amazon's Web Service (AWS) cloud or on a local high-performance compute cluster.

name: iobio
description: Realtime Genomic Analysis. IOBIOuses immediate visual feedback to make understanding complex genomic datasets more intuitive, and analysis more interactive
institutions: University of Utah - Department of Human Genetics

name: Freebayes
description: Bayesian haplotype-based polymorphism discovery and genotyping

name: DTASelect
description: DTASelect organizes and filters SEQUEST identifications, reducing the time required to interpret the results for each sample.

name: quickVol II
description: QuickVol II is a simple tool designed to enable quick browsing and visualization of MRI and fMRI data, transformation and co-registration of volume data sets, and ad-hoc computations using transformed volumes as inputs, from any Java® enabled platform.

name: UMMPerfusion
description: An OsiriX plugin for calculation of perfusion parameters on the basis of 4-dimensional datasets.

name: ANALYZE
description: Analyze is the most comprehensive, robust and productive software package available for 3D biomedical image visualization and analysis. The synergistic integration of comprehensive and generic tools for visualization, processing, and quantitative analysis of biomedical images in a highly operator-interactive, intuitive interface has allowed surgeons, physicians, and basic scientists to explore large multidimensional biomedical image volumes efficiently and productively.

name: Expression Atlas
description: The Expression Atlas database provides information on gene expression patterns under different biological conditions. It consists of two components: the 'differential' and 'baseline' atlases. The Differential Atlas, containing both microarray and sequencing data, allows users to query which genes are up-/down-regulated in different experimental conditions, e.g. 'in Arabidopsis shoots, what genes are upregulated in plants treated by X?' The Baseline Atlas, containing exclusively RNA-seq data, displays expression levels of gene products under 'normal' conditions (e.g. normal human tissues).

name: MetaboLights
description:
MetaboLights is a database for Metabolomics experiments and derived information.
The database is cross-species, cross-technique and covers metabolite structures and their reference spectra as well as their biological roles, locations and concentrations, and experimental data from metabolic experiments.We will provide search services around spectral similarities and chemical structures.

name: PSICQUIC View
description: PSICQUIC is a project within the HUPO Proteomics Standard Initiative (HUPO-PSI). It standardises programmatic access to molecular interaction databases.

name: ProTurn
description: Calculation of protein turnover rates from heavy water labeling mass spectrometry experiments.

name: MyVariant.info
description: MyVariant.info provides simple-to-use REST web services to query/retrieve variant annotation data, aggregated from many popular data resources. It’s designed with simplicity and performance emphasized. You can use use it to annotate discovered variants with the up-to-date variant annotation; or query for specific known variants using a combination of your query criteria, especially across multiple data resources (e.g. to get all variants on gene CDK2, having polyphen2 score > 0.99, and also found in cosmic database using this query). MyVariant.info can also be used to power a web application which requires querying or retrieving variant annotations, without the need of maintaining your own local database backend.

name: Trans-Proteomic Pipeline (TPP)
description: The Trans-Proteomic Pipeline (TPP) is a suite of software tools for the analysis of MS/MS data sets. The tools encompass most of the steps in a proteomic data analysis workflow in a single, integrated software system. Specifically, the TPP supports all steps from spectrometer output file conversion to protein-level statistical validation, including quantification by stable isotope ratios. We describe here the full workflow of the TPP and the tools therein, along with an example on a sample data set, demonstrating that the setup and use of the tools are straightforward and well supported and do not require specialized informatic resources or knowledge.
funding: •National Institutes of Health. Grant Numbers: N01-HV-28179, R44HG004537
•Center for Systems Biology. Grant Number: PM50 GMO76547

name: BD2KPubMed
description: BD2KPubMed is a software tool that employs publicly available data to analyze scientific trends and research directions in a particular field of interest.

name: SwissSkullStripper (Slicer plugin)
description: Slice4 extension for the Swiss Skull Stripper. The algorithm registers a grayscale atlas image to the graysacle patient data. The associated atlas brain mask is propagated to the patient data using the registration transformation. This brain mask is eroded and serves as initialization for a refined brain extraction based on level-sets. The level-set towards the edge of the brain-skull border with dedicated expansion, curvature and advection terms.
authors: Stefan Baue,Thomas Fejes,Mauricio Reyes, Arnaud Gelas
funding: European Union within the framework of the ContraCancrum project

name: StripsTs
description:
"This command line tool for Windows extracts the brain region from volumetric medical images of the head.
Skull stripping is performed by registration of an atlas and level-set-based refinement of the brain region. The tool works best if image and atlas are of the same modality, but different modalities are also possible."
authors: Stefan Bauer , Thomas Fejes and Mauricio Reyes
funding: European Union within the framework of the ContraCancrum project

name: dcm4che
description: dcm4che2 is a high performance, open source implementation of the DICOM standard. It is developed in the Java programming language

name: www.monarchinitiative.org
description: Genotype-phenotype data integration platform that includes a diversity of human, model, and non-model organisms. Data integration is accomplished using a large suite of interoperable ontologies, including the Human Phenotype Ontology and the Uberon anatomy ontology. Downstream tools such as Exomiser leverage these data for disease diagnostics and variant prioritization. These integrated data are available for computational reuse and deep phenotyping quality assurance.

name: Microsoft Research Volume Rendering SDK
description: COM components which provides scalable implementation of real-time volume rendering intended for server-based GPUs. It could also be accessed from .Net clients using the provided Runtime Callable Wrapper (RCW)

name: GeoS
description: GeoS is a software tool for the semi-automatic segmentation of 3D medical images such as CT or MR scans.

name: fpimage
description: FP Image DICOM Browser, has ability to organize a database of files on local file system. Has DICOM browser, cine player/creator, multiple formats including user defined, image manipulation, conversion and processing.

name: Tudor DICOM Tools
description: Tudor DICOM Tools are a Java library to perform high-level DICOM operations. The library includes stand-alone applications and ImageJ plugins. Functionality includes reading and writing to DICOM files or DICOMDIR filesets, network transfers including client and PACS server functions, and image viewing and analysis. Most of the functions can be used as ImageJ macros. Included are the library and sample applications built from it, such as the Tudor DICOM Viewer.

name: K-PACS
description: The K-PACS Workstation is a powerful DCMTK-based DICOM viewer that provides tools for manipulating, measuring and converting DICOM images into several formats. Additionally, the software implements the most important DICOM service classes like store, query/retrieve, send and move. Thus you can query picture archives comfortably, download pictures, upload foreign pictures to archives and export pictures on CD, on local hard drive or via email.

name: PGCTN
description: DICOM server and web-based viewer.

name: DicomWorks
description: DicomWorks is a DICOM viewer and converter for Windows. It includes: a smart DICOM viewer with 4 panel display,an export wizard, DICOM CD-ROM reader and writer, archiver, database, and many other features. It supports a programming API with plugin architecture.

name: XIP: The Extensible Imaging PI
description: The eXtensible Imaging Platform (XIP) project is an Open Source framework and platform for rapidly developing Medical Imaging applications that are "plug-and-play" across multiple computing environments. It offers an extensible set of modules for researchers to develop and evaluate software solutions for research and clinical problems.

name: XNAT
description: A comprehensive imaging/PACS package. The Extensible Neuroimaging Archive Toolkit (XNAT) is an open source software platform designed to facilitate management and exploration of neuroimaging and related data. XNAT includes a secure database backend and a rich web-based user interface. Based on DCM4CHE, it contains tools for viewing images locally and through a network connection, and PACS functionality.

name: ImageVis3D
description: ImageVis3D is a new volume rendering program. The main design goals of ImageVis3D are: simplicity, scalability, and interactivity. Simplicity is achieved with a new user interface. Scalability and interactivity for ImageVis3D mean that both on a notebook computer as well as on a high end graphics workstation, the user can interactively explore terabyte sized data sets. The open source nature and component-by-component design allow developers to extend ImageVis3D itself but also reuse parts of it, such as the rendering core.
funding: National Institute of General Medical Sciences of the National Institutes of Health under grant number P41 GM103545-17
DOE SciDAC Visualization and Analytics Center for Enabling Technologies, DEFC0206ER25781
institutions: Center for Integrative Biomedical Computing, University of Utah

name: InVesalius
description: InVesalius generates STL-format 3D surfaces from CT and MRI DICOM input files. Multiple masks can be defined and stored as a project. Standard viewing options including MPI are also available. The program is written in Python and runs on Windows and Linux.

name: XnView
description: Multipurpose graphic converter capable of reading 400 file formats and writing 50, including some medical image files. Includes batch conversion of DICOM to TIFF, JPG etc.

name: IrfanView
description: A popular, fast image viewing program for Windows. Geared towards flat image files but can read some medical formats including DICOM.

name: StrokeTool-CT
description: Interactive software for evaluation and analysis of contast enhanced dynamic CT perfusion imaging. Uses established SVD algorithms for the deconvolution of the arterial input function with the pixel based intensity time curves. Contains inbuilt DICOM receiver.

name: MEDWX
description: DICOM viewer and PACS console based on Python, wxPython, and the Zope database.

name: DICOM Vista Light
description: DICOM Vista 2.5 is a system for processing and visualization of CT & MR images. It is a DICOM Storage SCP, allowing a simple PC to receive images from any system that supports DICOM Storage SCU

name: DWV - DICOM Web Viewer
description: DWV is a web DICOM viewer in pure Javascript and HTML5. It can be used on any modern browser without any downloads or plugins. It does not require a file system and works on computers, mobile devices and internet-capable TVs. DWV can be incorporated into a PACS server that supports the WADO protocol, allowing web-based searching and viewing of DICOM studies, and can also be launched through a URL based on such a server. Depending on browser support, DWV can also load images from a local filesystem.

name: Slice:Drop
description: Slice:Drop is a web-based 2D/3D viewer using WebGL and HTML5 Canvas to perform image rendering in a web browser. Based on the open source XTK toolkit, Slice:Drop runs on computers and mobile devices. On systems with a filesystem, image files may be dropped on the rendering window, and all data stays within the browser. Many medical image file formats are supported natively.

name: ImLook4D
description: ImLook4D provides full 4D viewing analysis using only the base Matlab toolbox. Originally designed for PET/CT, it is tightly integrated with Matlab, making it suitable for algorithm development and experimentation. Brush-based ROIs may be stored and retrieved. ImLook4D is extensible by drop-in Matlab scripts, of which 20 are provided, and can export its workspace to Matlab and ImageJ.

name: MedView
description: MedView is a medical (Dicom) image viewer able to be used on any html5 capable device. The viewer displays images stored on a standard Dicom Server

name: RseqFlow2
description: RNA-Seq analysis pipeline which offers an express implementation of analysis steps. It can perform pre and post mapping quality control (QC) for sequencing data, calculate expression levels for uniquely mapped reads, identify differentially expressed genes, and convert file formats for ease of visualization.
publicationDOI: RseqFlow: workflows for RNA-Seq data analysis. Bioinformatics, 2011, 27 (18): 2598–2600

name: GotCloud
description:
To handle the increasing volume of next generation sequencing and genotyping data, we created and developed software pipelines called Genomes on the Cloud (GotCloud).
GotCloud contains Mapping & Variant Calling Pipelines.

name: gkno
description: A flexible bioinformatics pipeline launcher

name: bamtools
description: BamTools provides both a programmer's API and an end-user's toolkit for handling BAM files

name: SEQUEST
description: SEQUEST performs automated peptide/protein sequencing via database searching of MS/MS spectra without the need for any manual sequence interepretation.

name: tool1
description: description

name: RawExtracter
description: RawExtractor is a program to extract MS and MS/MS spectra from RAW files generated by Thermo mass spectrometers, such as LTQ, LTQ-Orbitrap, LCQ, and stores the spectra in ms1, ms2 or mzXML file format. The spectra files generated by RawExtractor program are used as input for protein identification programs SEQUEST, ProLuCID and quantitatation program Census.

name: PatternLab for Proteomics
description: PatternLab provides tools for analyzing shotgun proteomic data quantitated by spectral counting (with DTASelect) or labeling (with Census). The modules provide means to point differentialy expressed proteins / peptides (ACFold / TFold modules), find proteins with simmilar expression profiles in time-course experiments (TrendQuest module), find unique proteins to a state (Area proportional venn diagram module) and help interpreting results according to the Gene Ontology (Gene Ontology Explorer module).
institutions: Federal University of Rio de Janreiro, Brazil

name: YADA
description: YADA can deisotope and decharge high-resolution mass spectra from large peptide molecules, link the precursor monoisotopic peak information to the corresponding tandem mass spectrum, and account for different co-fragmenting ion species (multiplexed spectra).  YADA also enables a pipeline consisting of ProLuCID and DTASelect for analyzing large-scale middle-down proteomics data.

name: GutenTag
description: GutenTag is software to identify peptides by the sequence tagging technique. SEQUEST searches a sequence database by mass, but GutenTag searches with short sequences derived directly from the spectrum.

name: Unitemare
description: A tool developed for migrating existing SEQUEST results to the new unified file format.

name: Census
description: Quantitative Analysis Tool for both labeling and labeling free analysis.

name: DeBunker
description: DeBunker is a phosphorylation validation program

name: Charge Prediction Machine
description: The Charge Prediction Machine (CPM) is a tool for Inferring Precursor Charge States of Low Resolution Electron Transfer Dissociation Tandem Mass Spectra.
institutions: Federal University of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

name: Colander
description: Colander is a MS/MS data pre-processing program for selecting CID MS/MS spectra generated from phosphopeptides.

name: ProteinInferencer
description: A proteomics tool developed to calculate protein FDR for both individual experiments and large-scale proteomics projects that combine multiple sample fractions or experiments.
institutions: The Scripps Research Institute, La Jolla

name: ProLuCID
description: ProLuCID is a fast and sensitive tandem mass spectra-based protein identification program recently developed in the Yates laboratory at The Scripps Research Institute.

name: PRIDE Archive
description: The PRIDE PRoteomics IDEntifications (PRIDE) database is a centralized, standards compliant, public data repository for proteomics data, including protein and peptide identifications, post-translational modifications and supporting spectral evidence. PRIDE is a core member in the ProteomeXchange (PX) consortium, which provides a single point for submitting mass spectrometry based proteomics data to public-domain repositories. Datasets are submitted to PRIDE via ProteomeXchange and are handled by expert biocurators.

name: REACTOME
description: Reactome is a free, open-source, curated and peer reviewed pathway database. Our goal is to provide intuitive bioinformatics tools for the visualization, interpretation and analysis of pathway knowledge to support basic research, genome analysis, modeling, systems biology and education.

name: OLEA Sphere
description: OLEA SPHERE is an image processing software package intended for picture archive, post-processing and communication. It standardizes across vendors both viewing and analysis capabilities of conventional and dynamic MRI and CT imaging datasets.

name: nordicICE
description: nordicICE couples a perfusion package and a permeability analysis package. With these modules a large range of physiologically relevant parameters related to tissue perfusion and capillary permeability can be addressed both qualitatively and semi-quantitatively using state-of-the-art methods.

name: ProteomeXchange
description: The ProteomeXchange consortium has been set up to provide a coordinated submission of MS proteomics data to the main existing proteomics repositories, and to encourage optimal data dissemination.

name: nordicBrainEx
description: nordicBrainEx is a comprehensive neuro imaging software for functional MRI specifically designed for the clinical workflow. Simple and user-friendly interface improves user productivity, while the automated protocols, processing steps and quality control features minimize the probability of error or variability in the quality of the results.

name: SPIN
description: SPIN deals with the processing for a number of MRI sequences such as: SWI, PWI, MR angiography (MRA), dynamic contrast enhanced imaging (DCE), special image processing features such as interpolation and other mathematical operations, and special features for ease of use by clinicians. Specifically, the SWI module in SPIN makes it possible to combine magnitude and phase images and create minimum intensity maps over an arbitrary range of the tissue of interest. We also have new features (over and above what is offered in the Siemens SWI product for the 3T TRIO) for performing anti-aliasing and special processing of high pass filtered phase images. The MRA module offers a region growing algorithm to find the vessel tree starting from a specific vessel, and has the ability to simulate vessel flow. The PWI module provides cerebral blood volume (CBV), first moment mean transit time (fMTT), cerebral blood flow (CBF), bolus arriving time BAT), full-width half maximum estimates of MTT, time-to peak (TTP) and peak change in signal (PCS) images. All these maps are available in color coded images. The DCE module generates IAUC and CIAUC plots directly to a Microsoft Excel chart. SPIN also includes basic algorithms in imaging processing, such as subtraction, superimpositon, pixel division, averaging, offset shifting, edge detection, erosion, dilation, 2D parabolic fitting, sliding window filtering, complex thresholding, chirp-z transform dilation, and partial Fourier Transform processing.
institutions: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Institute for Biomedical Research

name: ComKAT
description: COMKAT is a software package for compartmental modeling oriented for biomedical image quantification.

name: ExploreDTI
description: "ExploreDTI" is a graphical toolbox, developed by Alexander Leemans, for exploratory diffusion (tensor) MRI and fiber tractography.
licenses: Free for research or educational use

name: Perfusion Mismatch Analyzer
description: A versatile free software for quantitative analysis of perfusion and diffusion imaging of cerebrovascular disorders

name: ASGENSENG
description:
Copy-number variants (CNVs) are a major form of
genetic variation and a risk factor for various human
diseases, so it is crucial to accurately detect
and characterize them. It is conceivable that allelespecific
reads from high-throughput sequencing
data could be leveraged to both enhance CNV detection
and produce allele-specific copy number (ASCN)
calls. Although statistical methods have been developed
to detect CNVs using whole-genome sequence
(WGS) and/or whole-exome sequence (WES)
data, information from allele-specific read counts
has not yet been adequately exploited. ASGENSENG
incorporates allele-specific read
counts in CNV detection and estimates ASCN using
either WGS or WES data.
authors: Weibo Wang, Wei Wang, Wei Sun, James J. Crowley and Jin P. Szatkiewicz
institutions: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

name: Spotlite
description: Spotlite is a web application for predicting co-complexed proteins from affinity purification-mass spectrometry data.
funding: Sidney Kimmel Foundation for Cancer Research
institutions: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

name: CLUBS+
description: CLUBS+ provides a  clustering algorithm that offers  major advantages over current algorithms for around-centroids clustering.  In fact, CLUBS+ is (i) totally unsupervised, (ii) significantly faster, and (iii)  producing very high-quality results. For that, CLUBS+ uses a combination of divisive,  agglomerative, and partitional approaches, that has been shown to outperform  other centroid clustering methods on both synthetic and real-life data sets.

name: EnigmaVis
description: EnigmaVis is a tool for generating interactive plots that you can use to visualize and navigate datasets from ENIGMA.

name: CANaLI
description: CANaLI is a Question Answering system that allows to query RDF Knowledge Bases using a Controlled Natural Language. The English-based language and the autocompletion system, that guides the user in entering well-formed questions, makes CANaLI easy to be learnt and used. The matching of the phrases typed by the user with the elements of the underlying knowledge base is performed on-the-fly and the subsequent translation of the question into a SPARQL query is nearly instant. Results are presented in a user friendly snippet format. The system is implemented as a Java web-application, thus, and it is accessible through any JavaScript-enabled browser.

name: Sage Synapse
description: Sage Bionetworks has developed Synapse as an informatics platform dedicated to supporting the large-scale pooling of data, knowledge, and expertise across institutional boundaries to solve some of the most challenge problems in biomedical research.

name: ANTS
description: Advanced Normalization Tools (ANTs) extracts information from complex datasets that include imaging. ANTs development is led by Brian Avants and supported by other researchers and developers at PICSL and other institutions.
authors: Brian B. Avants, Nick Tustison and Hans Johnson
institutions: University of Pennsylvania, University of Virginia, University of Iowa

name: RadiAnt DICOM Viewer
description: This is a software for viewing the medical images (DICOM)

name: Bratumia
description: This command line tool for Windows extracts the brain region from volumetric medical images of the head. Skull stripping is performed by registration of an atlas and level-set-based refinement of the brain region

name: NiftySeg
description: "This project, developed at University College London, contains programs to perform EM based segmentation of images in nifti or analyse format.seg_EM is a general purpose intensity based image segmentation tool. In it's simplest form, it takes in one 2D or 3D image and segments it in n classes. This function has implemented several other improvements (Please click the hyperlinks to go to specific sections): •	Masking for region-of-interest selection [link] •	Input anatomical priors, either as a series of images or as a 4D image. These priors should be pre-registered [link] •	Markov Random Field for spatial consistency [link] •	Bias field inhomogeneity correction to compensate for B0 non-uniformities. The Bias corrected image can also be outputted [link] •	Outlier detection as in Van Leemput et al. TMI (2003) [link] • Prior relaxation as in Cardoso et al. MICCAI (2011) [link] •	Semi-conjugate prior over the model parameters as explained in Cardoso et al. MICCAI (2011) "

name: Medical Image Processing Toolbox
description: View image and perform image processing operations such as image resample, image reslice, etc

name: dcm2nii
description: This is a tool to conver dicom into nii format

name: RAPID
description: RAPID is used to view stroke patient's images, including PWIs and DWIs, RAPID will calculate the mismatch volume in PWI-DWI mismatch

name: GLISTR
description: GLISTR is a software package designed for simultaneously segmenting brain scans of glioma patients and registering these scans to a normal atlas.

name: Brainsuite
description: BrainSuite is a collection of software tools that enable largely automated processing of magnetic resonance images (MRI) of the human brain. The major functionality of these tools is to extract and parameterize the inner and outer surfaces of the cerebral cortex and to segment and label gray and white matter structures. BrainSuite also provides several tools for visualizing and interacting with the data

name: TrackVis
description: TrackVis is a software tool that can visualize and analyze fiber track data from diffusion MR imaging (DTI/DSI/HARDI/Q-Ball) tractography

name: Cedars-Sinai Cardiac Suite
description: A software suit that contains several softwares for providing segmentation, quantification, and analysis of static and gated/ungated myocardial perfusion SPECT scans, gated short axis blood pool SPECT scans, static and gated myocardial perfusion PET

name: XD3
description: View DICOM data on PET/CT, PET/MR, etc. And perform rigid and deformable fusion

name: Invia Corridor 4DM
description: Allow instant review of nuclear cardiology imaging. Provides clinically validated algorithms for image analysis.

name: Freeview
description: Freeview is a visualization tool similar in functionality to tkmedit, tksurfer, and scuba. It differs from tkmedit in that it can load multiple volumes at once and can be used to visualize high resolution (100um) data as well as tractography splines.

name: AFNI
description: AFNI (which might be an acronym for Analysis of Functional NeuroImages) is a set of C programs for processing, analyzing, and displaying functional MRI (FMRI) data

name: Camino
description: Camino is an open-source software toolkit for diffusion MRI processing. The toolkit implements standard techniques, such as diffusion tensor fitting, mapping fractional anisotropy and mean diffusivity, deterministic and probabilistic tractography

name: Freesurfer
description: An open source software suite for processing and analyzing (human) brain MRI images.

name: Caseaccess
description: Provide physician with real-time access to patient's PET/CT information

name: NeuroQ
description: A software for neuro oncology and dementia analysis; it provides higher level of diagnostic confidence over visual imaging analysis.

name: Deeds: Dense Displacement Sampling for Deformable Registration
description: Perform deformable registration using deeds, which employs a discrete dense displacement sampling for the deformable registration of high resolution CT volumes

name: MIND: Modality Independent Shape Descriptor for Multi-modal Deformable Registration
description: Tool to perform deformable registraton in multi-modality via using modality independent neighbourhood descriptor (MIND)

name: MRIcron
description: MRI image viewer for multiple platforms

name: GIFT
description: GIFT is an application developed in Matlab that enables group inferences from fMRI data using Independent Component Analysis (ICA)

name: ANTs
description: ANTs is useful for managing, interpreting and visualizing multidimensional data. ANTs is popularly considered a state-of-the-art medical image registration and segmentation toolkit

name: Diffusion Toolkit
description: Diffusion Toolkit is a set of command-line tools with a GUI frontend that performs data reconstruction and fiber tracking on diffusion MR images

name: MaZda
description: MaZda is a computer program for calculation of texture parameters (features) in digitized images

name: BoneJ
description: BoneJ is a plugin for bone image analysis in ImageJ. It provides free, open source tools for trabecular geometry and whole bone shape analysis

name: BRAINSConstellationDetector
description: A fully automatic algorithm for anterior and posterior commisures (AC/PC) detection on MRI scans
institutions: University of lowa hospitals and clinics

name: Diffeomorphic registration of 2D/3D nifti images (including: Piecewise-Diffeomorphic Image Registration
description: Perform large deformation diffeomorphic metric mapping registration with sliding conditions
funding: EPSRC ER/H050892/1 and Cancer Research UK/EPSRC Oxford Cancer Imaging Centre

name: BioImage Suite
description: An integrated image analysis software suite for cardiac and abdominal image analysis

name: blox
description: A quantitative medical imaging & visualization program for use on brain MR, DTI, and MRS data.

name: resolutionmd
description: Allow doctors to securely view patient images and reports

name: Aliza Dicom Viewer
description: Renders 2d/3d images and MPR; provides image co-registration using Elastix

name: BrainVisa
description: A tool box for segmentation of T1-weighted MR images

name: syngo
description: software to make reading, storing, and sharing clinical images easier and more efficient .

name: NiftyRec
description: NiftyRec is a software for tomographic reconstruction, providing the fastest GPU-accelerated reconstruction tools for emission and transmission computed tomography.
maintainers: Martinos Center for Biomedical Imaging – Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) – Harvard University.

name: BRAINSFit
description: A program for registering images
tags: registration,Intermodal, Intersubject, Affine Warp, Linear Warp

name: Tools for NLfT1 and ANALYZE image
description: A MATLAB toolkit to view, and do modification (e.g., reslice) for NIfT1 images

name: BRAINScut
description: Provide segmentation using artificial neural networks

name: BrainMush
description: Tool to generate brain volume mask from input of T1 and T2-weighted images alongside a region of interest brain mask

name: BrainsROIAuto
description: Automatically creates a mask based on the 'foreground' of an anatomical scan volume

name: DTI-TK
description: DTI-TK is a spatial normalization and atlas construction toolkit optimized for examining white matter morphometry using DTI data.
maintainers: Dr Gary Zhang and Dr Paul Yushkevich

name: Dynamic functional connectivity
description: Study dyamic brain connectivity during rest

name: 3DimViewer
description: 3DimViewer is an open source, lightweight 3D viewer with native installers for all platforms. 3DimViewer can display multiplanar and orthogonal views, and volume and surface renderings with thresholding-based tissue segmentation. GPU acceleration is used for volume rendering. Fully-documented C++ source code is provided.

name: 3DView
description: 3DView uses 2D or 3D textures to render volumetric data. Features: - Alpha blended display of volumetric data using 2D or 3D textures - Maximum Intensity Projection (MIP) - Multi-Planar Reformatting (MPR) - Up to six fixed-orientation moveable cut planes - Interactive fly-through - Stereoscopic display using anaglyph or dual viewport methods - Interactive transfer function modification - Iso-surface mesh generation - 3D Watershed segmentation - Raw data and DICOM data import options

name: TubeTK
description: TubeTK is an open-source toolkit for the segmentation, registration, and analysis of tubes and surfaces in images.

name: Aeskulap - DICOM Viewer
description: Aeskulap is a medical image viewer for Linux and Windows. It provides for viewing of local files and can query PACS servers and fetch images from them. The goal of this project is to create a full open source replacement for commercially available DICOM viewers. Aeskulap is based on gtkmm, glademm and gconfmm and designed to run under Linux. It is available in source format, compiled for several versions of Linux, and through some Linux package installers such as yum (Fedora/Red Hat Linux).

name: CAAS Workstation
description: CAAS Workstation features quantification of coronary and peripheral arteries, analysis of left and right ventricle of the heart and enhanced visualization of stent deployment regions. The flexible GUI layout enables analysis in both cathlab and workstation settings. Multiple analyses can be performed simultaneously and side by side.

name: 3D-DOCTOR
description: 3D-DOCTOR is an advanced 3D modeling, image processing and measurement software for MRI, CT, PET, microscopy, scientific, and industrial imaging applications.
licenses: Able Software Corp. All Rights Reserved.

name: AFNI_MatlabLib
description: A set of Matlab functions that allows one to read and write certain AFNI data sets.

name: IBMiner
description: IBminer is a novel NLP-based system for deriving summary information from free text in the form of subject-attribute-value triples. IBminer employs the SemScape text mining framework to generate a set of subject-attribute-value triples from free text, and maps the attributes to those introduced by IBminer. The mapping is performed using the categorical information of subject and values, as well as the existing matches between generated triples and the ones in current InfoBoxes. Our experiments showed that IBminer generates high-quality results when processing large scale textual documents.

name: SWiPE
description: SWiPE (Searching Wikipedia by Example) is a user-friendly interface that allows semantic and well-structured knowledge bases (such as DBpedia) to be easily queried directly from Wikipedia's pages. Using Swipe, naive users with no knowledge of RDF triples and SPARQL can easily query DBpedia with powerful questions like "Find the town in California with less than 10 thousand people". This is accomplished by a novel Search by Example (SBE) approach where a user can enter the query conditions directly on the Infobox of a Wikipedia page. In fact, SWiPE activates various fields of Wikipedia to allow users to enter query conditions, and then uses these conditions to generate equivalent SPARQL queries and execute them on DBpedia. Finally, SWiPE returns the query results in a form that is conducive to query refinements and further explorations.
funding: National Science Foundation under Grant No. IIS 1118107

name: The Cardiac Organellar Protein Atlas Knowledgebase (COPaKB)
description: COPaKB is an integrated, cloud-based platform for shotgun proteomics data analysis. It provides pre-assembled computational pipelines for users to identify proteins from mass spectrometry (MS) data files, retrieve relevant biomedical annotations on protein functions, and generate consolidated reports for data visualizations, all at one centralized location.

name: DeAL
description: The Deductive Application Language System ( DeALS ) is a next-generation Datalog system. DeALS supports recursion, negation, and built-in and user-defined aggregates. DeALS also supports advanced features including XY -Stratified Datalog , which is a type of locally stratified Datalog , and aggregates that can be used in recursive rules. With support for many powerful constructs, a wide range of complex applications can be expressed. Three execution engines for DeALS have been designed and implemented namely, a sequential Java-based interpreter for prototyping and testing, a multi-core parallel C++ implementation and a distributed implementation on Apache Spark.

name: LONI Debabeler
description: "The Debabeler is a robust and extensible tool used to create and customize translations between medical image file formats. Its visual programming environment provides an intuitive and easy way to modify a variety of existing translations to meet researchers' needs."

name: Context-aware Synonym Suggestion System
description: Context-aware Synonym Suggestion System (CS3) learns synonyms from text by using our NLP-based text mining framework SemScape, and also from existing evidence in the current knowledge bases. Using CS3 and our knowledge extraction system IBminer, we integrate some of the publicly available knowledge bases into one of the superior quality and coverage, called IKBstore.

name: AMIDE: Amide's a Medical Imaging Data Examiner
description: AMIDE is a competely free tool for viewing, analyzing, and registering volumetric medical imaging data sets. It's been written on top of GTK+, and runs on any system that supports this toolkit

name: AmbiVU 3D
description: The AmbiVU 3D DICOM viewer workstation is most likely the fastest 3D Workstation available, to date we’ve yet to find one faster. The AmbiVU 3D Workstation displays studies from any modality with the widest range of 3D rendering methods, for surgical planning and image diagnosis. AmbiVU 3D fits perfectly into your 3D workflow requirements, delivering easy to use, high-quality 3D imaging.

name: LONI BrainSuite
description: "BrainSuite13 is a collection of image analysis tools designed to process magnetic resonance images (MRI) of the human brain. BrainSuite13 provides an automatic sequence to extract cortical surface mesh models from the MRI, tools to register these to a labeled atlas to define anatomical regions of interest, and tools for processing diffusion imaging data including coregistration to anatomical data, ODF and tensor fitting and tractography. BrainSuite13 also contains visualization tools for exploring these data, and can produce interactive maps of regional connectivity."
authors: David W. Shattuck, Anand A. Joshi, Chitresh Bhushan, Justin P. Haldar, Andrew C. Krause, Richard M. Leahy

name: LONI Mouse BIRN Atlasing Toolkit (MBAT)
description: "MBAT provides a workflow environment bringing together online resources, a user's image data and biological atlases in a concise, unified and intuitive workspace. MBAT is written in java so it is platform independent and is extensible through its plugin architecture."
authors: CIT- BIC, UCLA - LONI, Duke - CIVM, UCSD - NCMIR, Informatics Center for Mouse Neurogenetics at UTHSC, Drexel, and BIDMC

name: LONI Pipeline Processing Environment
description: "The LONI Pipeline is a free workflow application primarily aimed at Neuroimaging Researchers. With the LONI Pipeline, users can create workflows that take advantage of all the greatest Neuroimaging tools available, quickly."

name: LONI ShapeViewer
description: "The LONI ShapeViewer is a simple, portable geometry viewer that supports the file formats used by CCB researchers and provides their most commonly needed viewing functions. Since it is written in Java, it can run on a wide variety of computers."

name: LONI SurfaceWarpTools
description: "The Surface Warping protocol warps a collection of shapes to an atlas, using sets of sulcal contours to guide the warp. The atlas is computed from the contours provided by the user, and the resulting shapes will have anatomically homologous vertices."

name: LONI jViewbox
description: "A portable software framework for medical imaging research. jViewbox consists of a set of Java classes organized under a simple and yet extensive API that provides the core functionality of 2-D image presentation needed by most imaging applications."

name: LONI Automated Image Registration (AIR)
description: "A tool for automated registration of 3D and 2D images within and across subjects and across imaging modalities. The AIR library can easily incorporate automated image registration into site specific programs adapted to your particular needs."

name: LONI Brain Parser
description: "Brain Parser software segments regions of interest based on a training set of data and generates 3D MRI volumes. The software comes pre-trained on a provided data set but can be retrained to work with your desired regions of interest."

name: HAMMER Suite
description: HAMMER is the acronym for Hierarchical Attribute Matching Mechanism for Elastic Registration (Dinggang Shen, Christos Davatzikos, HAMMER: Hierarchical Attribute Matching Mechanism for Elastic Registration, IEEE Trans. on Medical Imaging, 21(11):1421-1439, Nov 2002), an algorithm for elastic registration of medical images using geometric moment invariants as attributes and hierarchical attribute matching mechanism for finding deformation field. We have implemented HAMMER registration algorithm under the framework of ITK, and also provided the HAMMER registration as a module for the 3DSlicer. Moreover, we have significantly improved the speed of HAMMER registration algorithm, as well as its registration accuracy in the new version of HAMMER algorithm included in the software package.

name: Visualization Toolkit (VTK)
description: The Visualization Toolkit (VTK) is an open-source, freely available software system for 3D computer graphics, image processing, and visualization. It consists of a C++ class library and several interpreted interface layers including Tcl/Tk, Java, and Python. Kitware, whose team created and continues to extend the toolkit, offers professional support and consulting services for VTK. VTK supports a wide variety of visualization algorithms including scalar, vector, tensor, texture, and volumetric methods, as well as advanced modeling techniques such as implicit modeling, polygon reduction, mesh smoothing, cutting, contouring, and Delaunay triangulation. VTK has an extensive information visualization framework and a suite of 3D interaction widgets. The toolkit supports parallel processing and integrates with various databases on GUI toolkits such as Qt and Tk. VTK is cross-platform and runs on Linux, Windows, Mac, and Unix platforms.

name: MIPAV
description: The MIPAV (Medical Image Processing, Analysis, and Visualization) application enables quantitative analysis and visualization of medical images of numerous modalities such as PET, MRI, CT, or microscopy. Using MIPAV's standard user-interface and analysis tools, researchers at remote sites (via the internet) can easily share research data and analyses, thereby enhancing their ability to research, diagnose, monitor, and treat medical disorders.
licenses: Medical Image Processing, Analysis and Visualization

name: ITK-snap
description: ITK-SNAP is a software application used to segment structures in 3D medical images. It is the product of a decade-long collaboration between Paul Yushkevich, Ph.D., of the Penn Image Computing and Science Laboratory (PICSL) at the University of Pennsylvania, and Guido Gerig, Ph.D., of the Scientific Computing and Imaging Institute (SCI) at the University of Utah, whose vision was to create a tool that would be dedicated to a specific function, segmentation, and would be easy to use and learn. ITK-SNAP is free, open-source, and multi-platform.

name: ImagJ
description: ImageJ is a public domain, Java-based image processing program developed at the National Institutes of Health. ImageJ was designed with an open architecture that provides extensibility via Java plugins and recordable macros.Custom acquisition, analysis and processing plugins can be developed using ImageJ's built-in editor and a Java compiler. User-written plugins make it possible to solve many image processing and analysis problems, from three-dimensional live-cell imaging to radiological image processing,multiple imaging system data comparisons to automated hematology systems. ImageJ's plugin architecture and built-in development environment has made it a popular platform for teaching image processing.

name: OncoRep
description: OncoRep is a fully automated RNA-Seq based report for patients with (breast) cancer, which includes molecular classification, detection of altered genes, detection of altered pathways, identification of gene fusion events, identification of clinical actionable mutations (in coding regions) and identification of treatable target structures. Furthermore, OncoRep reports suitable drugs based on identified actionable targets, which can be considered in the treatment decision making process.

name: Osirix
description:
OsiriX is an image processing software dedicated to DICOM images (".dcm" / ".DCM" extension) produced by imaging equipment (MRI, CT, PET, PET-CT, SPECT-CT, Ultrasounds, ...). It is fully compliant with the DICOM standard for image comunication and image file formats. OsiriX is able to receive images transferred by DICOM communication protocol from any PACS or imaging modality (C-STORE SCP/SCU, and Query/Retrieve : C-MOVE SCU/SCP, C-FIND SCU/SCP, C-GET SCU/SCP, WADO) .
OsiriX has been specifically designed for navigation and visualization of multimodality and multidimensional images: 2D Viewer, 3D Viewer, 4D Viewer (3D series with temporal dimension, for example: Cardiac-CT) and 5D Viewer (3D series with temporal and functional dimensions, for example: Cardiac-PET-CT). The 3D Viewer offers all modern rendering modes: Multiplanar reconstruction (MPR), Surface Rendering, Volume Rendering and Maximum Intensity Projection (MIP). All these modes support 4D data and are able to produce image fusion between two different series (PET-CT and SPECT-CT display support).

name: LONI Visualization Tool
description: "An interactive tool for stereotaxic brain data visualization. LOVE is a 3-D viewer that allows volumetric data display and manipulation of axial, sagittal and coronal views."

name: elastix
description: elastix is open source software, based on the well-known Insight Segmentation and Registration Toolkit (ITK). The software consists of a collection of algorithms that are commonly used to solve (medical) image registration problems. The modular design of elastix allows the user to quickly configure, test, and compare different registration methods for a specific application. A command-line interface enables automated processing of large numbers of data sets, by means of scripting.

name: ITK-SNAP
description: ITK-SNAP is a software application used to segment structures in 3D medical images
